intro: Polyotus, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically heart-shaped with a silvery underside, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, white or pink flowers that are followed by dark blue or black berries.
